Key Arguments: The legislation threatens fundamental freedoms and rights that Australians have fought to preserve.
Existing laws are sufficient to address vilification, slander, and malicious statements.
Definitions of misinformation and disinformation in the proposed Bill are too broad, risking severe limitations on free speech.
The criteria for misinformation, such as potential harm to the environment, could be used to push governmental ideologies.
Politicians are unjustly exempt from the proposed Bill, which undermines accountability.
Notable Quotes: The federal government has no right to either significantly reduce, or take away any of these fundamental rights of a democratically constituted nation.

The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are far too broad, and thus there is a very real risk that if this Bill was passed it would severely limit free speech in the Australian community.
Why should politicians be exempt from this proposed Bill.
